title: Iamcrypticguy
author: Iamcrypticguy
content: Becoming a crypto influencer is often a challenging endeavor, requiring motivation, dedication, and diligence to build your brand. Often, you need a boost in the form of partnerships or to be part of a community to gain the necessary exposure to thrive.However, a problem arises when it comes to finding the right community or program to partner with. This post is aimed at addressing that issue. Does anyone know of a program that could assist me in becoming KOL or someone with influence and doesn't have overly difficult requirements to fulfill? I'll be in the comment section

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: First what's your aim for wanting to be a crypto-currency influencer? And you have touched the main topic like what's your knowledge of crypto-currency. With the  remote nature of being an influencer or a content creator even though it's not exactly easy people wants to become and influencer or a content creator without first searching for knowledge. That's the first question to ask, you can have a mentor or some influencers that really motivates you, you should pick up notes from them, and just like everything great takes time you should not be in a hurry.

They want to become an influencer to get more money passively and more easily from referral programs, affiliate earnings and trading fee commissions.They can be paid to write articles, make videos, host livestreams that are ordered by altcoin project teams. With such money incentivize behind, you can not expect neutral reviews from influencers (scammers).Bitcoin videos on Youtube....and a suggestion for our possible BCT channel.A true influencer I admire a lot is Andreas Antonopoulos with his technical guides, books and free videos on his Youtube channel.

One of the major problem people have is that they just want to delve into crypto because they consider it to be lucrative industry but its not the best way to go.Secondly, you can't be a KOL in everything about crypto, you need to carve a nitch for yourself, more reaon why the fundamental is elemental to your crypto journey. From the fundamental, you'll know what catches your interest and what you're passionate about, becuase in the days of the beers only the passion will sustain you.

comments.author: ShinyStarPrincess
comments.body: I think nobody gets your question judging by the comments I've seen so far. I believe you're asking if there's something like a platform or special program that recruits people who want to become KOLs or Influencers in the industry. There's a thing called Bitget Builders, I've seen some of their posts on Twitter asking for interested persons to join in, and here's a link for that. https://www.bitget.com/support/articles/12560603796735. This could be a great start for you and it is a lot easier than the second option I'm going to recommend.Secondly, you can opt to grow solo by yourself, like creating meaningful and educative content on social media platforms and when you attain some level of fame, you'll find big companies reaching out to you with endorsement deals and partnership offers. Both are going to be profitable in the long run if you're indeed good at what you do. But I do hope you're knowledgeable in this field in order to excel.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: I don't know about programs, but that's not how I imagine the process. I think a person needs to try creating content that will reach a significant audience on any social media platform, and the content doesn't even need to be crypto-related. The crypto stuff can come in later, gradually, if reaching an audience while making content centred on cryptos proves to be challenging. Then, once a person succeeds in that, sponsors can reach out and vice versa. It just doesn't make much sense for companies to invest in someone who isn't significant already when there are people who've already achieved something and thus already have a promising audience.

comments.author: bittraffic
comments.body: You gotta know what you are gonna be talking about which requires knowledge of crypto, blockchain, and the news around crypto, especially the regulations and adoptions. The one that I noticed about those influencers was that they invite people of their kind from the community. Invite a crypto influencer to your podcast or maybe invite someone from this forum, I think this will be interesting. Although they may wanna remain anonymous, you can ask them to wear something to be unrecognizable.

comments.author: Bushdark
comments.body: I think you have to start somewhere first by creating your own account in any of the social media that you want and start creating contents. It all depends on the kind of influencer you want to be whether a cryptocurrency, gaming, gambling, comedy, music influencer etc. You will need to focus on a particular aspect that people will know you for that particular thing. It is very important for you to decide now and start working on how to build your own brand and contents that will look exceptional to the community you are in. Also it takes hard works and consistency to achieve it.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: Iamcrypticguy on August 31, 2023, 03:37:14 PMBecoming a crypto influencer is often a challenging endeavor, requiring motivation, dedication, and diligence to build your brand. Often, you need a boost in the form of partnerships or to be part of a community to gain the necessary exposure to thrive.If you aim at becoming a crypto influencer, do not let money be the only reason why you are interested in it, because many crypto influencers from the past have disappointed and lost the trust of their followers because they love money too much and will accept any offer to promote any coin even if the coin does not really have any strong background. So they receive money, and promote a coin that they are not even sure of, leading to many of their followers loosing money to these dubious projects. Also, in wanting to become a crypto influencer, also understand that you will be under the watchful eyes of the SEC and can be prosecuted for endorsing and promoting fake investment opportunities in cryptocurrency. To be an influencer with a difference, you have to be more dedicated to securing and preserving the trust your followers will have in you, and not abuse that trust to manipulate them for financial gains.

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: Is there a school where people learn how to be influencers? I don’t think so. I think the key to being an influencer is providing content on a particular niche, and organically build a following. Once you have a niche carved out, and you know what you are doing, you just have to keep putting our content consistently, people who are interested will find you and refer other people to your page or channel. As for promotions, you can partner with other influencers in the space to gather more followers/subscribers. Cross promotion is the best way to grow a new account. When you have become established in the space, you can then be called an “influencer”.

I'll be in the comment sectionCertainly, it is a challenging task to become crypto influencer, but it is not impossible. In order to capture attention and influence your audience, it is essential to follow some necessary steps, such as educating yourself by gaining deep understanding of block chain technology, learning how to create quality content in the forms of articles or videos and engaging in various social platform like twitter, face book and discord to stay updated, and expand your social network through engagements with others.Above all else, it is important to remember that genuine passion is the driving force behind achieving any goal in life.
